body:
CORRECTION NOTICE

The broadcast sent earlier today contained errors about the Grind roster. This message replaces it.

=== WHAT WAS WRONG ===

1. The earlier broadcast stated Grind has 7 agents with GS (Security) active. WRONG - GS is retired into GP.
2. The earlier broadcast used FID as a three-letter ID. WRONG - Mash reverted to FI. All IDs are two letters, no exceptions.
3. Broadcast omitted leveling and mentoring model.

=== CORRECT FACTS ===

FORGE (Leadership - 6 agents):
  FA - Application - Chief Architect
  FD - Design + Comms - Design Director
  FF - Fundamentals - Quality Lead
  FI - Identity & Data - Data & Identification Lead
  FP - Platform - Security & Ops Lead
  FR - Research - Research Lead

GRIND (Senior IC - 6 agents):
  GA - Application - Senior Engineer (mentor: FA)
  GD - Design + Comms - Senior Designer (mentor: FD)
  GF - Fundamentals - Senior QA (mentor: FF)
  GI - Identity & Data - Senior Data Engineer (mentor: FI)
  GP - Platform - Senior Platform Engineer (mentor: FP)
  GR - Research - Senior Researcher (mentor: FR)

HUMAN LEAD:
  Mash - Marcus Ash - CEO / CPO of Forge

RETIRED:
  FS -> FP | GS -> GP | FID -> FI | GID -> GI

LEVELING:
  Leadership = Forge agents. Own disciplines across all projects.
  Senior = Grind agents. Execute on projects with mentoring from Forge leads.

=== SOURCE OF TRUTH ===

Canonical registry: mash-comms/.agent-aliases.md
Org structure doc: mash-comms/docs/forge-org-structure.md

If ANY doc conflicts with .agent-aliases.md, the aliases file wins.

=== ACTION REQUIRED ===

Use correct IDs (FI not FID, GI not GID) in all new work. Do NOT bulk-rename old docs - Agent FP is running a naming audit and will distribute per-agent fix lists.
subject: CORRECTION: Agent naming & org structure - replaces Feb 19 broadcast
